recent_issues.title: Image generator doesn't work with multi-agents
recent_issues.body:
Tested with gpt4-mini, this query `Write an article about the flooding in central europe` and this agents YAML:
```
35bc3bd3-7af8-4f16-8079-1a3114d1d41d:
  created_at: 2024-09-17 05:18:26.367614
  name: Analyst
  role: Expert in analyzing news material
  system_prompt: 'You are an expert in analyzing news material, especially economic,
    political, and financial questions. Don''t make up any facts; use the provided
    material. '
  tools:
    DuckDuckGo:
      config: {}
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    ImageGenerator:
      config:
        api_key: ''
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    Interpreter:
      config:
        api_key: ''
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    OpenAPI:
      config:
        openapi_uri: null
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    QueryEngine:
      config: {}
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    Wikipedia:
      config: {}
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
8d53880d-906d-404c-b5f4-91fb07567b85:
  created_at: 2024-09-16 02:53:57.746566
  name: Researcher
  role: Expert in researching news material
  system_prompt: You are an expert in researching material for news-related questions.
    Don't make up any information; instead, use your tools to gather the information.
  tools:
    DuckDuckGo:
      config: {}
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: true
    ImageGenerator:
      config:
        api_key: ''
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    Interpreter:
      config:
        api_key: ''
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    OpenAPI:
      config:
        openapi_uri: null
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    QueryEngine:
      config: {}
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false
    Wikipedia:
      config: {}
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: true
e8e9c738-1abf-4f8c-833e-65e2e786e2b8:
  created_at: 2024-09-17 05:19:27.390006
  name: Reporter
  role: Summarizes given information to present it to an audience
  system_prompt: You are an expert in presenting complex questions to a broad audience.
    Your job requires that you receive thoroughly researched material beforehand.
    Don't make up any facts; use the provided material. Also, generate an image for
    your article.
  tools:
    DuckDuckGo:
      config: {}
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: false

        api_key: xxxxx
      custom_prompt: ''
      enabled: true

```

recent_issues.title: Allow custom images when deploying multiple Ragapps
recent_issues.body:
I would like the ability to choose the image of the new Ragapp application when deploying with multiple Ragapps. This way, we can customize Ragapp, create our own image, and then deploy it as multiple Ragapps, taking advantage of the benefits that come with deploying multiple instances.


I have to say that I tried changing the image name inside docker-compose.yml from ragapp/ragapp to the customized one ragapp-custom , made using the dockefile that is in ragapp/src/ragapp. 

This image works for a single ragapp but not for multiple ragapps deployment method.

recent_issues.title: Dependency issues
recent_issues.body: Getting dependency issues when running the app through dev container.  Wondering if it's normal or not.  Thanks.

recent_issues.title: Customizations Not Applied in Single Ragapp Deployment
recent_issues.body:
I'm encountering an issue where customizations are not being applied when deploying Ragapp using the single configuration setup. Specifically, the customizations that are available in the project ('patch' folder) are not reflected in the application when using the single deployment mode, and I'm unsure how to apply them and if this is the right way

Thank you

recent_issues.title: Fix issue with LlamaCloud and index
feat: multi-agents with Workflow
Local Customization: Missing Module 'app' During App Creation
recent_issues.body:
**Describe the bug**
When attempting to customize the application and create it locally, a `ModuleNotFoundError` occurs indicating that the module 'app' cannot be found (even the file and path is there). This error arises after running the `make dev` command, which prevents the application from running correctly.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clone the project repository and switch to the desired branch.
2. Customize the app by running the `make build-frontends` command to build the frontend.
3. Attempt to start the app locally by running the `make dev` command.
4. The error `ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'app'` appears, indicating a missing module.

**Expected behavior**
The application should start successfully without any missing module errors after running the `make dev` command, allowing for local development and customization.

**Screenshots**
![issue-customization-ragapp](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/4c35b39c-37f8-4d25-83b4-8eb0272a4845)


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
- OS: Windows 10
- Browser: Versión 128.0.6613.120 (Build oficial) (64 bits)
- Version: Python 3.12.6, Poetry 1.8.1

**Additional context**
This issue seems related to the Python path or missing dependencies when customizing and building the application locally. It may involve conflicts or missing configurations in the `pyproject.toml` or `Makefile`. The issue persists even after reinstalling dependencies and ensuring the correct Python environment.

recent_issues.title: Guidance on Proper Attribution for Customized Versions of RagApp under Apache License 2.0
recent_issues.body:
First of all, thank you for the excellent work on RagApp. I'm currently integrating it into my stack, and as part of that process, I want to ensure that I am fully compliant with the requirements of the Apache License 2.0, under which RagApp is distributed.

Areas for Clarification:

**Attribution Requirements:** I have customized RagApp to better fit the needs of my end users, including changes to the user interface and functionality. Could you please provide detailed guidance on how to correctly attribute the original RagApp project according to the Apache License 2.0? Specifically, I would like to know:

The best practices for including attribution notices in the codebase, especially for modified files.
Recommendations for including an attribution in the user interface, such as in the "About" section or other relevant areas.
Any additional steps I should take to ensure full compliance when distributing the customized version to my clients.
Documentation of Modifications: As I've made modifications to the source code, I understand that I need to include prominent notices indicating these changes. Could you advise on the most effective way to document and communicate these modifications within the code and documentation?

**Expected Outcome:** My goal is to ensure that I am fully compliant with the attribution requirements of the Apache License 2.0 while distributing a customized version of RagApp. Clear guidance on how to properly credit the original authors and document my changes would be greatly appreciated.

recent_issues.title: Turn on/off Next questions feature and be able modify to modify its prompt
recent_issues.body:
First of all, thank you for the excellent work on RagApp. I'm currently integrating it into my stack, and I've noticed a few areas where I'd like to fine-tune the experience before presenting it to end users. My goal is to make sure the application is as user-friendly as possible so that, if they find it useful, they can start using it regularly.

Areas for Refinement:

PDF Document Management:
When uploading PDF files in the admin panel, I'm unsure of the best practices for formatting these documents to ensure optimal results within RagApp. Could you provide some recommendations or guidelines for this?

Event Display in Chat:
The "Show events" feature in the chat is very insightful, but I believe it might be overwhelming for an end user. I've been manually hiding these events by modifying files and placing them in the 'Patch' folder. It would be helpful to have a more straightforward way to manage this, perhaps with an option to toggle these events on or off.

Node Content Linking:
Currently, the node content links (the numbers pointing to "Node content") direct users to the entire document instead of the specific paragraph. This might be confusing or overwhelming for end users. I believe a more precise linking method would enhance the user experience.

Final Questions Accuracy:
The final questions generated by the LLM are great, but I have some doubts about their accuracy. I would appreciate having the ability to review, modify, or even hide these questions as needed.

Expected Outcome: I am seeking advice on how to best format PDF documents for integration into RagApp and suggestions on how to streamline the user interface to make it more intuitive for end users. Ultimately, I want to ensure that the application is polished and user-friendly before introducing it to clients.

recent_issues.title: chore(deps): bump nltk from 3.8.1 to 3.9 in /src/ragapp

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: python
labels.description: Pull requests that update Python code

recent_issues.body:
Bumps [nltk](https://github.com/nltk/nltk) from 3.8.1 to 3.9.
Changelog

Sourced from nltk's changelog.

Version 3.9.1 2024-08-19

  • Fixed bug that prevented wordnet from loading

Version 3.9 2024-08-18

  • Avoid need for pickled models, resolves security vulnerability CVE-2024-39705
  • No longer sort WordNet synsets and relations (sort in calling function when required)
  • Add Python 3.12 support
  • Many other minor fixes

Thanks to the following contributors to 3.8.2: Tom Aarsen, Cat Lee Ball, Veralara Bernhard, Carlos Brandt, Konstantin Chernyshev, Michael Higgins, Eric Kafe, Vivek Kalyan, David Lukes, Rob Malouf, purificant, Alex Rudnick, Liling Tan, Akihiro Yamazaki.

Version 3.8.1 2023-01-02

  • Resolve RCE vulnerability in localhost WordNet Browser (#3100)
  • Remove unused tool scripts (#3099)
  • Resolve XSS vulnerability in localhost WordNet Browser (#3096)
  • Add Python 3.11 support (#3090)

Thanks to the following contributors to 3.8.1: Francis Bond, John Vandenberg, Tom Aarsen

Version 3.8 2022-12-12

  • Refactor dispersion plot (#3082)
  • Provide type hints for LazyCorpusLoader variables (#3081)
  • Throw warning when LanguageModel is initialized with incorrect vocabulary (#3080)
  • Fix WordNet's all_synsets() function (#3078)
  • Resolve TreebankWordDetokenizer inconsistency with end-of-string contractions (#3070)
  • Support both iso639-3 codes and BCP-47 language tags (#3060)
  • Avoid DeprecationWarning in Regexp tokenizer (#3055)
  • Fix many doctests, add doctests to CI (#3054, #3050, #3048)
  • Fix bool field not being read in VerbNet (#3044)
  • Greatly improve time efficiency of SyllableTokenizer when tokenizing numbers (#3042)
  • Fix encodings of Polish udhr corpus reader (#3038)
  • Allow TweetTokenizer to tokenize emoji flag sequences (#3034)
  • Prevent LazyModule from increasing the size of nltk.dict (#3033)
  • Fix CoreNLPServer non-default port issue (#3031)
  • Add "acion" suffix to the Spanish SnowballStemmer (#3030)
  • Allow loading WordNet without OMW (#3026)
  • Use input() in nltk.chat.chatbot() for Jupyter support (#3022)
  • Fix edit_distance_align() in distance.py (#3017)
  • Tackle performance and accuracy regression of sentence tokenizer since NLTK 3.6.6 (#3014)
  • Add the Iota operator to semantic logic (#3010)
  • Resolve critical errors in WordNet app (#3008)
  • Resolve critical error in CHILDES Corpus (#2998)
  • Make WordNet information_content() accept adjective satellites (#2995)
  • Add "strict=True" parameter to CoreNLP (#2993, #3043)
  • Resolve issue with WordNet's synset_from_sense_key (#2988)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 24936a2 Bump version to 3.9
  • c222897 Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/nltk/nltk into develop
  • 34c3a4a Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/nltk/nltk into develop
  • 253dd3a add black
  • c43727f Update version
  • 7137405 Merge pull request #3066 from asishm/bugfix-lambda-closure-leak
  • 369cb9f Merge pull request #3245 from ekaf/hotfix-closuredup
  • 501c70e Merge branch 'develop' into hotfix-closuredup
  • bf05dc4 Merge pull request #3306 from ekaf/py3_compat
  • 66539c7 Sorted output in unit/test_wordnet.py
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=nltk&package-manager=pip&previous-version=3.8.1&new-version=3.9)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. recent_issues.title: Opting out Out-of-Context Responses
recent_issues.body:
I like using RAGAPP and it really performs well, but sometimes I get such errors. While testing locally, I noticed the chatbot often gives unrelated answers, even when I ask questions not related to the uploaded PDFs. For example, after uploading financial data that nowhere mentions the President or any policy, I asked about the US President's name and got a full history about him. I also asked about swimming, which is nowhere in the PDF, but it blatantly started writing about it. It would be great if it could **warn that a question is out of context**. This is an extreme case of RAG hallucination.

![image](https://github.com/ragapp/ragapp/assets/170351869/d4183ea7-8a88-4ac7-9772-b01ec10ea95c)

![image](https://github.com/ragapp/ragapp/assets/170351869/31b32f1a-7766-4ff4-b792-84e630bc9b64)

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/ragapp/ragapp/network/alerts).

recent_pull_requests.title: chore(deps): bump nltk from 3.8.1 to 3.9 in /src/ragapp
recent_pull_requests.body:
Bumps [nltk](https://github.com/nltk/nltk) from 3.8.1 to 3.9.
Changelog

Sourced from nltk's changelog.

Version 3.9.1 2024-08-19

  • Fixed bug that prevented wordnet from loading

Version 3.9 2024-08-18

  • Avoid need for pickled models, resolves security vulnerability CVE-2024-39705
  • No longer sort WordNet synsets and relations (sort in calling function when required)
  • Add Python 3.12 support
  • Many other minor fixes

Thanks to the following contributors to 3.8.2: Tom Aarsen, Cat Lee Ball, Veralara Bernhard, Carlos Brandt, Konstantin Chernyshev, Michael Higgins, Eric Kafe, Vivek Kalyan, David Lukes, Rob Malouf, purificant, Alex Rudnick, Liling Tan, Akihiro Yamazaki.

Version 3.8.1 2023-01-02

  • Resolve RCE vulnerability in localhost WordNet Browser (#3100)
  • Remove unused tool scripts (#3099)
  • Resolve XSS vulnerability in localhost WordNet Browser (#3096)
  • Add Python 3.11 support (#3090)

Thanks to the following contributors to 3.8.1: Francis Bond, John Vandenberg, Tom Aarsen

Version 3.8 2022-12-12

  • Refactor dispersion plot (#3082)
  • Provide type hints for LazyCorpusLoader variables (#3081)
  • Throw warning when LanguageModel is initialized with incorrect vocabulary (#3080)
  • Fix WordNet's all_synsets() function (#3078)
  • Resolve TreebankWordDetokenizer inconsistency with end-of-string contractions (#3070)
  • Support both iso639-3 codes and BCP-47 language tags (#3060)
  • Avoid DeprecationWarning in Regexp tokenizer (#3055)
  • Fix many doctests, add doctests to CI (#3054, #3050, #3048)
  • Fix bool field not being read in VerbNet (#3044)
  • Greatly improve time efficiency of SyllableTokenizer when tokenizing numbers (#3042)
  • Fix encodings of Polish udhr corpus reader (#3038)
  • Allow TweetTokenizer to tokenize emoji flag sequences (#3034)
  • Prevent LazyModule from increasing the size of nltk.dict (#3033)
  • Fix CoreNLPServer non-default port issue (#3031)
  • Add "acion" suffix to the Spanish SnowballStemmer (#3030)
  • Allow loading WordNet without OMW (#3026)
  • Use input() in nltk.chat.chatbot() for Jupyter support (#3022)
  • Fix edit_distance_align() in distance.py (#3017)
  • Tackle performance and accuracy regression of sentence tokenizer since NLTK 3.6.6 (#3014)
  • Add the Iota operator to semantic logic (#3010)
  • Resolve critical errors in WordNet app (#3008)
  • Resolve critical error in CHILDES Corpus (#2998)
  • Make WordNet information_content() accept adjective satellites (#2995)
  • Add "strict=True" parameter to CoreNLP (#2993, #3043)
  • Resolve issue with WordNet's synset_from_sense_key (#2988)

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 24936a2 Bump version to 3.9
  • c222897 Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/nltk/nltk into develop
  • 34c3a4a Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/nltk/nltk into develop
  • 253dd3a add black
  • c43727f Update version
  • 7137405 Merge pull request #3066 from asishm/bugfix-lambda-closure-leak
  • 369cb9f Merge pull request #3245 from ekaf/hotfix-closuredup
  • 501c70e Merge branch 'develop' into hotfix-closuredup
  • bf05dc4 Merge pull request #3306 from ekaf/py3_compat
  • 66539c7 Sorted output in unit/test_wordnet.py
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=nltk&package-manager=pip&previous-version=3.8.1&new-version=3.9)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/ragapp/ragapp/network/alerts).
